canonical_explanation.text: We all need a house or shelter to live in. A house protects us from heat, cold, rain, wind, wild animals, and thieves. There are different types of houses like kutcha houses (made from mud, straw, and bamboo), pucca houses (made from bricks, cement, and concrete), flats, bungalows, huts, tents, and houseboats. The type of house people build depends on the weather, available materials, and the land they live on. In different parts of India, houses look very different. People in Kashmir live in houseboats, people in Assam build bamboo houses on stilts, and people in Rajasthan build stone houses to keep cool in the desert heat.
rules: A shelter or house protects us from heat, cold, rain, wind, animals, and thieves
Kutcha houses are made from mud, straw, bamboo, and leaves
Pucca houses are made from bricks, cement, concrete, and steel
Different regions have different types of houses based on climate and available materials
A good house should have proper ventilation (air flow), sunlight, and clean surroundings
The materials used to build a house depend on what is available locally

questions.question_text: Why do we need a house or shelter?

options.text: To protect us from heat, cold, rain, wind, and danger

questions.explanation_correct: We need a house to protect us from heat, cold, rain, wind, wild animals, and thieves. A house gives us a safe and comfortable place to live, sleep, eat, and spend time with our family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Houses are not just for storing toys or showing off. We need houses mainly for protection and safety. A house keeps us safe from bad weather (heat, cold, rain, storms), animals, and provides us a comfortable place to live.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a type of house?
questions.explanation_correct: A bungalow is a type of house. It is a large house usually with a garden around it. Other types of houses include flats, huts, tents, kutcha houses, and pucca houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Schools, hospitals, and temples are important buildings, but they are not houses where people live. A bungalow is a type of house - a large, spacious home usually built on one or two floors with a garden.

questions.question_text: A kutcha house is made from _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A kutcha house is made from natural materials like mud, straw, bamboo, and thatch (dried grass or leaves). These houses are commonly found in villages. They are easy to build but not very strong against heavy rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bricks and cement are used for pucca houses. Glass, steel, plastic, and rubber are not typical building materials for kutcha houses. Kutcha houses use simple, natural materials like mud, straw, bamboo, and dried leaves.

questions.question_text: A pucca house is stronger than a kutcha house because it is made from _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A pucca house is stronger because it is made from bricks, cement, concrete, and sometimes steel. These materials are hard and durable, making the house strong enough to last for many years and withstand rain and storms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paper, cloth, mud, straw, leaves, and grass are materials for weaker structures. Pucca houses use bricks, cement, and concrete, which are very strong and long-lasting. That is why pucca houses can stand for decades.

questions.question_text: A tent is a temporary shelter used by _____.

options.text: Nomads, soldiers, and people at campsites

questions.explanation_correct: Tents are temporary shelters used by nomads (people who move from place to place), soldiers in camps, tourists at campsites, and construction workers. Tents are easy to put up and take down, making them perfect for people who move often.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tents are not just for royalty or animals. They are practical shelters used by many people including nomads, soldiers, campers, and workers at temporary sites. Tents are lightweight, portable, and can be set up quickly anywhere.

questions.question_text: In a city, most people live in _____.
questions.explanation_correct: In cities, most people live in flats (apartments) in multi-storey buildings because there is limited space and many people need to live there. Tall buildings allow many families to live in the same area by stacking homes on top of each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Huts and tents are more common in villages and temporary sites. Caves were used by early humans. In modern cities, flats and apartments in multi-storey buildings are the most common type of housing because they use limited land space efficiently.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the correct difference between a kutcha house and a pucca house?

options.text: Kutcha houses are made of strong materials; pucca houses are made of weak materials
Kutcha houses are made of mud, straw, and bamboo; pucca houses are made of bricks and cement
Kutcha houses are found in cities; pucca houses are found in villages
There is no difference between them

questions.explanation_correct: The main difference is the building materials. Kutcha houses are made from weaker materials like mud, straw, and bamboo, while pucca houses are made from stronger materials like bricks, cement, and concrete. Pucca houses last longer and are sturdier.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kutcha houses use weaker materials (not stronger), and both types can be found in cities and villages. The correct answer is that kutcha houses use natural materials like mud and straw, while pucca houses use manufactured materials like bricks and cement.

questions.question_text: Bricks are made from _____.

options.text: Clay (a type of soil) that is baked in a kiln

questions.explanation_correct: Bricks are made from clay, which is a special type of soil. The clay is shaped into rectangular blocks and baked in a kiln (a very hot oven) until it becomes hard and strong. Bricks are one of the most common building materials in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bricks are not made from wood, paper, or plastic. They are made from clay soil that is moulded into shape and then heated in a kiln at very high temperatures. The heat makes the clay hard and durable, perfect for building walls.

questions.question_text: Which of these materials is used to hold bricks together when building a wall?
questions.explanation_correct: Cement is used to hold bricks together. Cement is mixed with sand and water to make a paste that hardens over time. This paste, called mortar, is spread between bricks to bind them together into a strong wall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Glue, tape, and string are not used for building walls. Cement is the correct material. When mixed with sand and water, cement makes a strong paste called mortar that sticks bricks together and becomes very hard when it dries.

questions.question_text: In villages near forests, people often build their houses using bamboo and wood because _____.

options.text: Bamboo and wood look more beautiful
These materials are easily available near forests
They do not like cement houses

questions.explanation_correct: People near forests use bamboo and wood because these materials are easily available in the forest nearby. It is practical to use materials that are close at hand. This is why house types vary from region to region.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The main reason is not beauty or personal preference. People use what is available near them. If they live near forests, bamboo and wood are abundant and free. In areas with clay soil, they use bricks. People build with what they can find locally.

questions.question_text: Which of these building materials comes from trees?
questions.explanation_correct: Wood comes from trees. Trees are cut and the wood is used for building houses, making furniture, doors, and window frames. Wood has been used as a building material for thousands of years.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cement is made from limestone and clay, bricks are made from clay soil, and steel is made from iron. Wood is the only material in this list that comes from trees. It is used for doors, beams, roofs, and furniture.

questions.question_text:
Match the building material with where it comes from:
1. Bricks  2. Wood  3. Stone  4. Bamboo
a. Mountains and quarries  b. Clay soil  c. Trees  d. Bamboo plants
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks are made from clay soil (b). Wood comes from trees (c). Stone comes from mountains and quarries (a). Bamboo comes from bamboo plants (d). Each building material has a different natural source.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct matching is: Bricks come from clay soil (which is shaped and baked), Wood comes from trees (which are cut for timber), Stone comes from mountains and quarries (where it is cut into blocks), and Bamboo comes from bamboo plants (which grow very fast).

questions.question_text: Houseboats are found in which Indian state?
questions.explanation_correct: Houseboats are famous in Kashmir. They float on the beautiful Dal Lake in Srinagar. People live in these beautifully decorated boats and tourists also stay in them. Houseboats in Kashmir are known for their woodwork and carpets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rajasthan is a desert state, Gujarat and Bihar do not have houseboat cultures. Kashmir is famous for its houseboats on Dal Lake in Srinagar. These boats serve as floating homes and are a major tourist attraction.

questions.question_text: In areas that flood often, houses are built on _____.
questions.explanation_correct: In areas that flood often, like parts of Assam and Kerala, houses are built on stilts. Stilts are strong poles that raise the house above the ground. When water rises during floods, the house stays above the water level.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Houses cannot be built on wheels or clouds, and underground homes would flood. In flood-prone areas, houses are raised on stilts (strong poles or pillars) so that flood water passes underneath without entering the house.

questions.question_text: People in Rajasthan build houses with thick stone walls and small windows. Why?

options.text: Because stone is the only material available
Thick walls keep the house cool in hot desert weather, and small windows keep out hot wind and sand
Because they do not like big windows

questions.explanation_correct: In Rajasthan's hot desert climate, thick stone walls keep the inside of the house cool by blocking the sun's heat. Small windows prevent hot desert wind and sand from blowing inside. This is how houses are adapted to the desert climate.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The design is not about personal preference or cost. It is about surviving in extreme heat. Thick walls act as insulation against the burning desert sun, and small windows stop hot winds and sand storms from entering the house.

questions.question_text: In Assam, many houses are built using bamboo because _____.

options.text: Bamboo is the strongest material in the world
Bamboo grows abundantly in the region and is light yet strong
People in Assam do not know how to use bricks
Bamboo houses do not need roofs

questions.explanation_correct: Assam has plenty of bamboo forests, so bamboo is easily available. Bamboo is lightweight but strong, making it perfect for building houses. Bamboo houses are also good for Assam's climate as they allow air to flow through and stay cool.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bamboo is not the strongest material in the world, and people in Assam certainly know about bricks. The reason is that bamboo grows abundantly in the area and is a practical building material - it is light, strong, and well-suited to the local climate.

questions.question_text: An igloo is a house made of _____ and is found in _____.

options.text: Ice and snow; very cold polar regions

questions.explanation_correct: An igloo is a dome-shaped house made from blocks of packed snow and ice. It is built by the Inuit people who live in very cold polar regions near the North Pole. The thick ice walls actually trap heat inside and keep the igloo warmer than the freezing outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Igloos are not made from mud, wood, or bamboo. They are made from blocks of ice and snow and are found in very cold polar regions. Surprisingly, the thick snow walls insulate the igloo and keep the people inside warm.

questions.question_text:
Match the house type with the region:
1. Houseboat  2. Stilt house  3. Igloo  4. Stone house with flat roof
a. Flood-prone areas  b. Polar regions  c. Kashmir  d. Rajasthan
questions.explanation_correct: Houseboat is found in Kashmir (c) on Dal Lake. Stilt house is found in flood-prone areas (a) like Assam. Igloo is found in polar regions (b) near the North Pole. Stone house with flat roof is found in Rajasthan (d) in the desert.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct matching is: Houseboat-Kashmir (floating on Dal Lake), Stilt house-flood-prone areas (raised above water), Igloo-polar regions (made of ice and snow), Stone house-Rajasthan (thick walls for hot desert climate).

questions.question_text: A good house should have windows for _____.

options.text: Fresh air and sunlight to come in

questions.explanation_correct: Windows are important in a house because they allow fresh air (ventilation) and sunlight to come in. Fresh air keeps the house from becoming stuffy, and sunlight keeps the house dry and kills germs. This makes the house a healthy place to live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Windows are not mainly for throwing things, watching neighbours, or decoration. Their main purpose is to let fresh air and sunlight into the house. Good ventilation and natural light make a home healthy and comfortable.

questions.question_text: Which of these makes a house unhealthy to live in?
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty surroundings and no ventilation (air flow) make a house unhealthy. Without fresh air, the house becomes stuffy and germs can multiply. Dirty areas attract flies and mosquitoes that carry diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Clean rooms, sunlight, fresh air, and gardens all make a house healthy. Dirty surroundings and no ventilation are what make a house unhealthy because germs, mosquitoes, and bad smells build up without fresh air and cleanliness.

questions.question_text: Amit's house has very small windows that are always shut. His family members often fall sick. What could be the reason?

options.text: Not enough fresh air and sunlight can come in
The house has too many rooms

questions.explanation_correct: When windows are small and always shut, fresh air cannot come in and stale air stays inside. Without sunlight, the house stays damp and germs can grow. This can make people living in the house fall sick frequently.
questions.explanation_incorrect: House size, number of rooms, and roof height are not the problem here. The problem is lack of ventilation and sunlight. When windows are shut, the air inside becomes stale, moisture builds up, and germs can spread, causing illness.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a feature of a good and healthy house?

options.text: Good ventilation, sunlight, and clean surroundings

questions.explanation_correct: A good and healthy house has good ventilation (air flow through windows), plenty of sunlight, and clean surroundings. These prevent germs from growing, keep mosquitoes away, and make the house comfortable and safe to live in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dark rooms, garbage near the door, and stagnant water all make a house unhealthy. Stagnant water breeds mosquitoes, garbage attracts flies, and dark rooms grow mould. A healthy house needs ventilation, sunlight, and cleanliness.

questions.question_text: A house protects us from rain, heat, and cold.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. One of the main purposes of a house is to protect us from the weather - rain, heat, cold, wind, and storms. The roof keeps rain out, walls protect from wind and cold, and the structure provides shade from the hot sun.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A house definitely protects us from weather conditions. The roof stops rain from falling on us, walls block wind and cold air, and the structure provides shade from the sun's heat. Protection from weather is a basic purpose of any shelter.

questions.question_text: All houses in India look exactly the same.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Houses in India look very different in different regions. Houses in Kashmir (houseboats), Assam (bamboo on stilts), Rajasthan (stone with flat roofs), and cities (apartments) all look very different from each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: India has a huge variety of house types. Different climates, materials, and traditions lead to different house designs. Mud houses in villages, bamboo houses in the northeast, stone houses in Rajasthan, and apartments in cities are all very different.

questions.question_text: Cement is used to join bricks together when building a wall.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Cement is mixed with sand and water to make mortar, which is spread between bricks. When this mortar dries, it becomes hard and holds the bricks firmly together, creating a strong wall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cement is indeed used to bind bricks together. When mixed with sand and water, it forms a sticky paste called mortar. This is applied between bricks, and when it hardens, it holds everything together in a strong wall.

questions.question_text: Houses on stilts are built in flood-prone areas to keep the house above water level.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Stilt houses are raised above the ground on strong poles or pillars. In areas where flooding is common (like parts of Assam and Kerala), this design keeps the living area above the flood water level, protecting the family.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is true. In areas that experience regular flooding, houses are built on stilts (raised platforms on poles). When flood water rises, it passes under the house without entering it, keeping the people and their belongings safe.

questions.question_text: People in cold hilly areas build houses with sloping roofs.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Houses in cold hilly areas have sloping (tilted) roofs so that rain and snow can slide off easily. If the roof were flat, heavy snow would pile up on top and could collapse the roof. The slope lets snow slide down safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. In cold, hilly, and snowy areas, sloping roofs are essential. Snow and rain slide off sloping roofs easily. If roofs were flat in snowy areas, the weight of collected snow could break the roof.

questions.question_text: A house with no windows and no fresh air is a healthy place to live.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. A house without windows would have no fresh air (ventilation) and no sunlight. This makes the air inside stale, allows dampness and germs to build up, and can make people sick. Every house needs windows for air and light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A house without windows would be dark, stuffy, and damp. Without fresh air circulation, germs can multiply. Without sunlight, the house stays damp and unhealthy. Good ventilation and sunlight are essential for a healthy home.

questions.question_text: A house made from bricks and cement is called a _____ house.
questions.explanation_correct: A house made from strong materials like bricks, cement, and concrete is called a pucca house. Pucca houses are strong, durable, and last for many years. Most houses in cities are pucca houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is pucca. A pucca house is made from permanent, strong materials like bricks, cement, concrete, and steel. It is the opposite of a kutcha house, which is made from temporary materials like mud and straw.

questions.question_text: A house made from mud, straw, and bamboo is called a _____ house.
questions.explanation_correct: A house made from natural, weaker materials like mud, straw, and bamboo is called a kutcha house. These houses are common in villages but are not as strong as pucca houses and can be damaged by heavy rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is kutcha. A kutcha house uses simple, natural materials like mud, straw, bamboo, and thatch. These materials are easy to find and cheap, but the houses are not as strong or long-lasting as pucca houses.

questions.question_text: The beautiful houseboats on Dal Lake are found in _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The beautiful houseboats on Dal Lake are found in Kashmir (specifically in Srinagar, the capital of Jammu and Kashmir). These houseboats are famous worldwide for their beautiful woodwork, carpets, and the stunning lake views they offer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Kashmir. Dal Lake in Srinagar, Kashmir is famous for its beautiful houseboats. These floating homes have been there for over a hundred years and are a unique feature of Kashmir's culture.

questions.question_text: Houses in Assam are often made from _____, which is a strong but lightweight plant material.
questions.explanation_correct: Houses in Assam are often made from bamboo. Bamboo is a grass that grows very tall and strong. It is lightweight, flexible, and grows abundantly in Assam. Bamboo houses are well-suited to the rainy, warm climate of Assam.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is bamboo. Bamboo is a versatile plant that grows plentifully in Assam and the northeast of India. It is strong enough to build houses and is used for walls, floors, roofs, and even furniture.

questions.question_text: A good house should have windows for _____ (fresh air) and sunlight.
questions.explanation_correct: A good house should have windows for ventilation (the flow of fresh air) and sunlight. Ventilation means the movement of fresh air into and out of a room. Good ventilation keeps the house cool, dry, and free from germs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is ventilation. Ventilation means the circulation of fresh air. Windows allow fresh air to come in and stale air to go out. This keeps the house healthy and comfortable.

questions.question_text: In hilly areas like Himachal Pradesh, houses have sloping roofs. The main reason for this is _____.

options.text: So that rain water and snow can slide off easily
Because flat roofs are more expensive
Because there is less sunlight in hills

questions.explanation_correct: Houses in hilly areas have sloping roofs so that rain water and snow can slide off easily. If roofs were flat, heavy snow would collect on top and could break the roof. Sloping roofs let snow and rain flow down safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reason is not about beauty or cost. In hilly areas that get heavy rain and snow, sloping roofs are a necessity. They prevent snow from piling up on the roof (which could collapse it) and let rainwater drain away quickly.

questions.question_text: A flat (apartment) in a multi-storey building is most common in _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Flats in multi-storey buildings are most common in cities. Cities have many people but limited land, so buildings are built tall to house many families. Each family lives in a separate flat on different floors of the same building.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Villages usually have individual houses with land, forests have no buildings, and mountains have smaller houses. In cities, land is expensive and limited, so tall buildings with many flats are built to accommodate many families in a small area.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a natural building material?
questions.explanation_correct: Stone is a natural building material. It is found in nature in mountains, hills, and quarries. It does not need to be manufactured in a factory. Other natural building materials include mud, wood, bamboo, and thatch.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plastic, glass, and steel are all man-made materials that need to be manufactured in factories. Stone is the only natural material listed. It is found in nature and can be used for building after being cut into the right shape.

questions.question_text: Why do people in very hot places like Rajasthan have flat roofs on their houses?

options.text: Because it never rains in Rajasthan
Because flat roofs can be used for sleeping on cool nights and drying food
Because sloping roofs are not allowed

questions.explanation_correct: In hot, dry places like Rajasthan, flat roofs serve many purposes. People sleep on the rooftop on cool nights to escape the heat inside. They also use flat roofs for drying food items like chillies and papad. Since it rains very little, there is no worry about rain collecting on the roof.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It does rain in Rajasthan (though very little). The reason for flat roofs is practical use - sleeping on the cool rooftop at night, drying food, and doing various activities. Since rain is rare, water collection on the roof is not a concern.

questions.question_text: A tent is a permanent house where people live for many years.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. A tent is a temporary shelter, not a permanent house. Tents are made of cloth or canvas and can be easily put up and taken down. They are used by nomads, soldiers, tourists, and at construction sites for a short time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tents are temporary, not permanent. They are designed to be portable and are used for short periods. Nomads carry tents as they move, soldiers use them in camps, and tourists use them while camping. They are not meant for permanent living.

questions.question_text: The type of building material used for a house depends on what is available in that area.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. People use materials that are easily available near them. People near forests use wood and bamboo, people in rocky areas use stone, people near clay deposits make bricks, and people in cold areas use ice to build igloos.
questions.explanation_incorrect: People naturally use the materials that are most easily available in their area. Near forests: wood and bamboo. Near quarries: stone. Near clay soil: bricks. In snowy areas: ice. This is why houses look so different across India and the world.

questions.question_text: Sunita's house has lots of plants and trees around it. How does this help?

options.text: Trees give shade, fresh air, and make the surroundings pleasant and cool

questions.explanation_correct: Trees and plants around a house provide many benefits. They give shade to keep the house cool, release oxygen for fresh air, block dust and noise, and make the surroundings green, pleasant, and beautiful.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Trees and plants around a house are very beneficial. They do not block entrances or attract dangerous animals. They provide cooling shade, fresh oxygen, reduce dust and noise, and make the area look beautiful and green.

questions.question_text: In areas that experience heavy snowfall, houses have _____ roofs so snow can slide off easily.
questions.explanation_correct: Houses in snowy areas have sloping (tilted) roofs. The slope allows heavy snow to slide down instead of piling up on the roof. If snow collected on a flat roof, its weight could cause the roof to collapse.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is sloping. A sloping roof is angled so that snow and rain slide down naturally. This is essential in areas with heavy snowfall like Himachal Pradesh, Kashmir, and Uttarakhand.

questions.question_text: Which type of shelter can float on water?
questions.explanation_correct: A houseboat is a type of shelter that floats on water. It is a boat designed to be used as a home. In India, houseboats are famous on Dal Lake in Kashmir and in the backwaters of Kerala.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Igloos are built on ice/snow on land, bungalows are on land, and tents are on land. A houseboat is the only shelter that floats on water. India's most famous houseboats are in Kashmir's Dal Lake and Kerala's backwaters.

questions.question_text: _____ are rectangular blocks made from clay and baked in a kiln, used for building walls.
questions.explanation_correct: Bricks are rectangular blocks made from clay soil that is shaped and then baked in a kiln (very hot oven). The high heat makes the clay hard and strong. Bricks are one of the most common building materials in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is Bricks. They are made by shaping clay into rectangular blocks and heating them in a kiln. Bricks are strong, durable, and used to build walls of houses all over India.

questions.question_text: In which part of India would you find houses made mainly of mud and stone with flat roofs?
questions.explanation_correct: In Rajasthan, which has a hot, dry desert climate, houses are made of mud and stone with flat roofs. Thick stone walls keep the house cool, and flat roofs are used for sleeping at night and drying food. Since it rarely rains, flat roofs work well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kerala has sloping roofs for heavy rain, Assam has stilt houses for floods, and Shimla has sloping roofs for snow. Rajasthan is the place with mud and stone houses with flat roofs, suited to the hot, dry desert climate.

questions.question_text: Which of these is MOST important for a house to have?

options.text: A strong roof, walls, ventilation, and clean surroundings

questions.explanation_correct: The most important things for a house are a strong roof (to protect from rain and sun), walls (to keep out wind, cold, and intruders), ventilation (for fresh air), and clean surroundings (to prevent diseases). These are basic needs, not luxuries.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Swimming pools, TVs, and expensive gates are luxuries, not necessities. The most essential features of any house are a strong roof for protection, solid walls for safety, windows for fresh air, and clean surroundings for good health.

questions.question_text: Long ago, early humans did not have houses. Where did they live?
questions.explanation_correct: Early humans lived in caves. Caves provided natural shelter from rain, wind, cold, and wild animals. Over time, humans learned to build their own shelters using branches, leaves, and animal skins, and eventually houses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tall buildings, aeroplanes, and swimming pools did not exist in early times. Early humans used natural caves as their homes. Caves gave them protection from weather and wild animals. Cave paintings found in India (like those at Bhimbetka) show how early humans lived.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a building material?
questions.explanation_correct: Chocolate is NOT a building material! Chocolate is a food item. Bricks, cement, and wood are all common building materials used to construct houses and buildings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bricks, cement, and wood are all used in building construction. Chocolate is a food made from cocoa beans and is definitely not used as a building material. It would melt in the sun!

questions.question_text: People build the same type of house everywhere in the world.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. People around the world build different types of houses based on their climate, available materials, and cultural traditions. Igloos in polar areas, bamboo houses in tropical areas, and stone castles in Europe are all very different.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Houses vary greatly around the world. Climate, available materials, and culture all influence house design. An igloo in the Arctic is completely different from a hut in Africa or an apartment in Mumbai. Each region has houses suited to its conditions.

questions.question_text: Stagnant water near a house can become a breeding ground for _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Stagnant (still, not flowing) water near a house can become a breeding ground for mosquitoes. Mosquitoes lay their eggs in still water, and their larvae grow in it. Mosquitoes can spread diseases like dengue and malaria.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is mosquitoes. Standing water around a house is dangerous because mosquitoes lay their eggs in still water. This leads to more mosquitoes, which can spread diseases like dengue, malaria, and chikungunya.

questions.question_text: Which statement about houses is TRUE?

options.text: Houses are needed only in cold places
Every person needs a shelter for protection and safety

questions.explanation_correct: Every person needs a shelter for protection and safety, regardless of whether they are rich or poor, or live in hot or cold places. A house is a basic need for all humans. Even animals need shelters - birds have nests, rabbits have burrows.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Everyone needs shelter, not just rich people. Houses are needed everywhere, not just in cold places. Even animals need shelters. The correct answer is that every person needs a shelter for protection and safety - it is a basic human need.
